sn12.4:1.2: “Mendicants, Vipassī the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha had this thought before his awakening, when he was still unawakened but intent on awakening:
sn12.4:1.3: ‘Alas, this world has fallen into trouble. It’s born, grows old, dies, passes away, and is reborn,
sn12.4:1.4: yet it doesn’t understand how to escape from this suffering, from old age and death.
sn12.4:1.5: Oh, when will an escape be found from this suffering, from old age and death?’
sn12.4:2.1: Then Vipassī, the one intent on awakening, thought:
sn12.4:2.2: ‘When what exists is there old age and death? What is a condition for old age and death?’
sn12.4:2.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:2.4: ‘When rebirth exists there’s old age and death. Rebirth is a condition for old age and death.’
sn12.4:3.2: ‘When what exists is there rebirth? What is a condition for rebirth?’
sn12.4:3.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:3.4: ‘When continued existence exists there’s rebirth. Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.’
sn12.4:4.2: ‘When what exists is there continued existence? What is a condition for continued existence?’
sn12.4:4.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:4.4: ‘When grasping exists there’s continued existence. Grasping is a condition for continued existence.’
sn12.4:5.2: ‘When what exists is there grasping? What is a condition for grasping?’
sn12.4:5.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:5.4: ‘When craving exists there’s grasping. Craving is a condition for grasping.’
sn12.4:6.2: ‘When what exists is there craving? What is a condition for craving?’
sn12.4:6.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:6.4: ‘When feeling exists there’s craving. Feeling is a condition for craving.’
sn12.4:7.2: ‘When what exists is there feeling? What is a condition for feeling?’
sn12.4:7.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:7.4: ‘When contact exists there’s feeling. Contact is a condition for feeling.’
sn12.4:8.2: ‘When what exists is there contact? What is a condition for contact?’
sn12.4:8.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:8.4: ‘When the six sense fields exist there’s contact. The six sense fields are a condition for contact.’
sn12.4:9.2: ‘When what exists are there the six sense fields? What is a condition for the six sense fields?’
sn12.4:9.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:9.4: ‘When name and form exist there are the six sense fields. Name and form are a condition for the six sense fields.’
sn12.4:10.2: ‘When what exists are there name and form? What is a condition for name and form?’
sn12.4:10.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:10.4: ‘When consciousness exists there are name and form. Consciousness is a condition for name and form.’
sn12.4:11.2: ‘When what exists is there consciousness? What is a condition for consciousness?’
sn12.4:11.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:11.4: ‘When choices exist there’s consciousness. Choices are a condition for consciousness.’
sn12.4:12.2: ‘When what exists are there choices? What is a condition for choices?’
sn12.4:12.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:12.4: ‘When ignorance exists there are choices. Ignorance is a condition for choices.’
sn12.4:13.1: And so, ignorance is a condition for choices.
sn12.4:13.2: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.4:13.3: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.4:13.4: ‘Origination, origination.’ While Vipassī was intent on awakening, such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in him regarding teachings not learned before from another.
sn12.4:14.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no old age and death? When what ceases do old age and death cease?’
sn12.4:14.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:14.4: ‘When rebirth doesn’t exist there’s no old age and death. When rebirth ceases, old age and death cease.’
sn12.4:15.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no rebirth? When what ceases does rebirth cease?’
sn12.4:15.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:15.4: ‘When continued existence doesn’t exist there’s no rebirth. When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.’
sn12.4:16.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no continued existence? When what ceases does continued existence cease?’
sn12.4:16.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:16.4: ‘When grasping doesn’t exist there’s no continued existence. When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.’
sn12.4:17.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no grasping? When what ceases does grasping cease?’
sn12.4:17.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:17.4: ‘When craving doesn’t exist there’s no grasping. When craving ceases, grasping ceases.’
sn12.4:18.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no craving? When what ceases does craving cease?’
sn12.4:18.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:18.4: ‘When feeling doesn’t exist there’s no craving. When feeling ceases, craving ceases.’
sn12.4:19.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no feeling? When what ceases does feeling cease?’
sn12.4:19.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:19.4: ‘When contact doesn’t exist there’s no feeling. When contact ceases, feeling ceases.’
sn12.4:20.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no contact? When what ceases does contact cease?’
sn12.4:20.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:20.4: ‘When the six sense fields don’t exist there’s no contact. When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases.’
sn12.4:21.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist are there no six sense fields? When what ceases do the six sense fields cease?’
sn12.4:21.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:21.4: ‘When name and form don’t exist there are no six sense fields. When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease.’
sn12.4:22.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist are there no name and form? When what ceases do name and form cease?’
sn12.4:22.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:22.4: ‘When consciousness doesn’t exist there are no name and form. When consciousness ceases, name and form cease.’
sn12.4:23.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no consciousness? When what ceases does consciousness cease?’
sn12.4:23.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:23.4: ‘When choices don’t exist there’s no consciousness. When choices cease, consciousness ceases.’
sn12.4:24.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist are there no choices? When what ceases do choices cease?’
sn12.4:24.3: Then, through proper attention, Vipassī comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.4:24.4: ‘When ignorance doesn’t exist there are no choices. When ignorance ceases, choices cease.’
sn12.4:25.1: And so, when ignorance ceases, choices cease.
sn12.4:25.3: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.4:25.4: ‘Cessation, cessation.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in Vipassī, the one intent on awakening, regarding teachings not learned before from another.”
sn12.4:26.1: (The text should be expanded in this way for each of the seven Buddhas.)
